Class CustomColorMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • linefit.CustomColorMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    class CustomColorMenu
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    A Class that extends JDialog that allows the user to choose custom colors to use for the lines
    Since:
    0.98.1
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Keith Rice

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  CustomColorMenu.CancelButtonListener
      A Listener class that listens for the cancel button or the close button to be pressed and then handles what is done
      private class  CustomColorMenu.ColorChangedListener
      A Listener class that is used to change the currently selected color for the DataSet to the selected one
      private class  CustomColorMenu.SelectButtonListener
      A Listener class that is used to see if the Select button has been clicked and then handle its action
      private class  CustomColorMenu.WindowClosingOverrideAdapter
      A private class that overrides WindowAdapter that allows us to override the default function when the close button is pressed

      • removeTransparencySlider

        private static void removeTransparencySlider(javax.swing.JColorChooser jColorChooserToRemoveFrom)
                                      throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                             java.lang.SecurityException,
                                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                             java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        A function that removes the transparency slider from the JColorChooser taken from stack overflow question: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12026767/java-7-jcolorchooser-disable-transparency-slider Post Author: user3455283
        Parameters:
        jColorChooserToRemoveFrom - The JColorChooser to remove the transparency slider from
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - throws this error if it cannot find the transparency slider to remove
        java.lang.SecurityException - throws this error if it encounters a security problem when removing the slider
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - throws this error if an illegal argument is encounter when trying to remove the transparency slider
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - throws this error if when removing the transparency slider we do not have access to remove the slider
